1.text: Whence [come] wars and whence fightings among you? [Is it] not thence,â€”from your pleasures, which war in your members?

2.text: Ye lust and have not: ye kill and are full of envy, and cannot obtain; ye fight and war; ye have not because ye ask not.

3.text: Ye ask and receive not, because ye ask evilly, that ye may consume [it] in your pleasures.

4.text: Adulteresses, know ye not that friendship with the world is enmity with God? Whoever therefore is minded to be [the] friend of the world is constituted enemy of God.

5.text: Think ye that the scripture speaks in vain? Does the Spirit which has taken his abode in us desire enviously?

6.text: But he gives more grace. Wherefore he says, God sets himself against [the] proud, but gives grace to [the] lowly.

7.text: Subject yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

8.text: Draw near to God, and he will draw near to you. Cleanse [your] hands, sinners, and purify [your] hearts, ye double-minded.

9.text: Be wretched, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to mourning, and [your] joy to heaviness.

10.text: Humble yourselves before [the] Lord, and he shall exalt you.

11.text: Speak not against one another, brethren. He that speaks against [his] brother, or judges his brother, speaks against [the] law and judges [the] law. But if thou judgest [the] law, thou art not doer of [the] law, but judge.

12.text: One is the lawgiver and judge, who is able to save and to destroy: but who art thou who judgest thy neighbour?

13.text: Go to now, ye who say, To-day or to-morrow will we go into such a city and spend a year there, and traffic and make gain,

14.text: ye who do not know what will be on the morrow, ([for] what [is] your life? It is even a vapour, appearing for a little while, and then disappearing,)

15.text: instead of your saying, If the Lord should [so] will and we should live, we will also do this or that.

16.text: But now ye glory in your vauntings: all such glorying is evil.

17.text: To him therefore who knows how to do good, and does it not, to him it is sin.
